line_2: But not so soon, but first I slipt

line_1: Around his heart the soft'ning passions crept,
line_2: He gaz'd he sigh'd, he wonder'd, and he wept;

line_1: The blood in stated pace had crept
Before the Pilgrims part, the Younger crept,
line_2: Near the clos'd Cradle where an Infant slept,

line_1: Where all the lazy moments crept,
The wandering stream has from his eyelids crept,
line_2: And his moist pillow shown he has not slept.

line_1: By slow degrees, to towering woods it crept,
line_2: As if beneath their shade it nightly slept.

line_1: From bard to bard the frigid caution crept,
line_2: Till declamation roar'd, while passion slept.
